DaD.item

Class ItemTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • DaD.item.ItemTemplate

  • public class ItemTemplate
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Clovis on 16/05/2017. Template from which ItemInstance are created. Template are NEVER USED in game. Instead player will ALWAYS USE ItemInstance.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Env> _allBonus
      The list containing all Env of the item.

      Max durability this template can reach.

      Max amount of time an itemInstance based on this template can be stacked.

      Base price when buying an ItemInstance based on this template.

      private int _requiredLevel
      Required level to equip ItemInstance base on this template.

      Type of item, basically: ring, sword, shield ...

    • Field Detail

      • _id

        private final int _id
        ID of the template. Mostly used when creating a new ItemInstance.

      • _name

        private final java.lang.String _name
        Name of the template. ItemInstance base on this template will have the same name.

      • _requiredLevel

        private final int _requiredLevel
        Required level to equip ItemInstance base on this template.

      • _price

        private final double _price
        Base price when buying an ItemInstance based on this template.

      • _rarity

        private final ItemRarity _rarity
        Rarity of the template. Doesn't affect stats only here to rank items.
        See Also:
        ItemRarity

      • _maxStack

        private final int _maxStack
        Max amount of time an itemInstance based on this template can be stacked.

      • _type

        private final ItemType _type
        Type of item, basically: ring, sword, shield ...
        See Also:
        ItemType

      • _maxDurability

        private final int _maxDurability
        Max durability this template can reach.

        You cannot have an higher durability on an itemInstance than the maxDurability of the template it's based on.

      • _weight

        private final double _weight
        Weight of item. Actually not used in inventory.

      • _equipable

        private final boolean _equipable
        Is the item equipable or not

      • _description

        private final java.lang.String _description
        Description of the item, can be short stories.

      • _equipSlot

        private final ItemEquipSlot _equipSlot
        Equip slot where the item should be equipped.
        See Also:
        ItemEquipSlot

      • _allBonus

        private final java.util.ArrayList<Env> _allBonus
        The list containing all Env of the item.
        See Also:
        Env

      • ItemTemplate

        public ItemTemplate(MultiValueSet itemsStats)
        Constructor of class.
        Parameters:
        itemsStats - MultiValueSet containing all info about the template.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Return the id of the template.
        Returns:
        int

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Return the name of the template.
        Returns:
        String

      • getAllBonus

        public java.util.ArrayList<Env> getAllBonus()
        Return the list containing all Env of the item. Each env represent a bonus / malus of the item.
        Returns:
        ArrayList
        See Also:
        Env

      • getBonusByStat

        public java.util.ArrayList<Env> getBonusByStat(Stats stat)
        Return the list of Env that concern this stat.
        Parameters:
        stat - The specific stat you want to focus on.
        Returns:
        ArrayList

      • isEquipable

        public java.lang.Boolean isEquipable()
        Return true if item is equipable.

        ItemTemplate cannot be equipped, but the ItemInstance based on this template can be

        Returns:
        Boolean
        See Also:
        ItemInstance

      • getPrice

        public double getPrice()
        Return the base price of this item.

        ItemTemplate cannot be sell or buy, but ItemInstance based on this template can be.

        Returns:
        double
        See Also:
        ItemInstance

      • getMaxStack

        public int getMaxStack()
        Return the maximum stack of this item.

        Item Template cannot be stacked, they are not usable ingame! ItemInstance base on this template may be stackable and stacked.

        Returns:
        int

      • getEquiSlot

        public ItemEquipSlot getEquiSlot()
        Return the equipSlot of the item.

        ItemTemplate cannot be equipped and so does not really have an equip slot. ItemInstance base on this template can be equipped and will be equipped on this equip slot.

        Returns:
        ItemEquipSlot

      • getRequiredLevel

        public int getRequiredLevel()
        Return the level required to equip this item.

        ItemTemplate cannot be equipped. ItemInstance base on this template can be equipped, if you meet the requirements.

        Returns:
        int

      • displayTemplate

        public void displayTemplate()
        Display all attributes of the template.
